10/*
11 * Details about Montgomery multiplication algorithms can be found at
12 * http://security.ece.orst.edu/publications.html, e.g.
13 * http://security.ece.orst.edu/koc/papers/j37acmon.pdf and
14 * sections 3.8 and 4.2 in http://security.ece.orst.edu/koc/papers/r01rsasw.pdf
15 */
16
17#include "internal/cryptlib.h"
18#include "bn_lcl.h"
19
20#define MONT_WORD /* use the faster word-based algorithm */
21
22#ifdef MONT_WORD
23static int bn_from_montgomery_word(BIGNUM *ret, BIGNUM *r, BN_MONT_CTX *mont);
24#endif
25
26int BN_mod_mul_montgomery(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *b,
27 BN_MONT_CTX *mont, BN_CTX *ctx)
28{
29 int ret = bn_mul_mont_fixed_top(r, a, b, mont, ctx);
30
31 bn_correct_top(r);
32 bn_check_top(r);
33
34 return ret;
35}
36
37int bn_mul_mont_fixed_top(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *b,
38 BN_MONT_CTX *mont, BN_CTX *ctx)
39{
40 BIGNUM *tmp;
41 int ret = 0;
42 int num = mont->N.top;
43
44#if defined(OPENSSL_BN_ASM_MONT) && defined(MONT_WORD)
45 if (num > 1 && a->top == num && b->top == num) {
46 if (bn_wexpand(r, num) == NULL)
47 return 0;
48 if (bn_mul_mont(r->d, a->d, b->d, mont->N.d, mont->n0, num)) {
49 r->neg = a->neg ^ b->neg;
50 r->top = num;
51 r->flags |= BN_FLG_FIXED_TOP;
52 return 1;
53 }
54 }
55#endif
56
57 if ((a->top + b->top) > 2 * num)
58 return 0;
59
60 BN_CTX_start(ctx);
61 tmp = BN_CTX_get(ctx);
62 if (tmp == NULL)
63 goto err;
64
65 bn_check_top(tmp);
66 if (a == b) {
67 if (!bn_sqr_fixed_top(tmp, a, ctx))
68 goto err;
69 } else {
70 if (!bn_mul_fixed_top(tmp, a, b, ctx))
71 goto err;
72 }
73 /* reduce from aRR to aR */
74#ifdef MONT_WORD
75 if (!bn_from_montgomery_word(r, tmp, mont))
76 goto err;
77#else
78 if (!BN_from_montgomery(r, tmp, mont, ctx))
79 goto err;
80#endif
81 ret = 1;
82 err:
83 BN_CTX_end(ctx);
84 return ret;
85}
86
87#ifdef MONT_WORD
88static int bn_from_montgomery_word(BIGNUM *ret, BIGNUM *r, BN_MONT_CTX *mont)
89{
90 BIGNUM *n;
91 BN_ULONG *ap, *np, *rp, n0, v, carry;
92 int nl, max, i;
93 unsigned int rtop;
94
95 n = &(mont->N);
96 nl = n->top;
97 if (nl == 0) {
98 ret->top = 0;
99 return 1;
100 }
101
102 max = (2 * nl); /* carry is stored separately */
103 if (bn_wexpand(r, max) == NULL)
104 return 0;
105
106 r->neg ^= n->neg;
107 np = n->d;
108 rp = r->d;
109
110 /* clear the top words of T */
111 for (rtop = r->top, i = 0; i < max; i++) {
112 v = (BN_ULONG)0 - ((i - rtop) >> (8 * sizeof(rtop) - 1));
113 rp[i] &= v;
114 }
115
116 r->top = max;
117 r->flags |= BN_FLG_FIXED_TOP;
118 n0 = mont->n0[0];
119
120 /*
121 * Add multiples of |n| to |r| until R = 2^(nl * BN_BITS2) divides it. On
122 * input, we had |r| < |n| * R, so now |r| < 2 * |n| * R. Note that |r|
123 * includes |carry| which is stored separately.
124 */
125 for (carry = 0, i = 0; i < nl; i++, rp++) {
126 v = bn_mul_add_words(rp, np, nl, (rp[0] * n0) & BN_MASK2);
127 v = (v + carry + rp[nl]) & BN_MASK2;
128 carry |= (v != rp[nl]);
129 carry &= (v <= rp[nl]);
130 rp[nl] = v;
131 }
132
133 if (bn_wexpand(ret, nl) == NULL)
134 return 0;
135 ret->top = nl;
136 ret->flags |= BN_FLG_FIXED_TOP;
137 ret->neg = r->neg;
138
139 rp = ret->d;
140
141 /*
142 * Shift |nl| words to divide by R. We have |ap| < 2 * |n|. Note that |ap|
143 * includes |carry| which is stored separately.
144 */
145 ap = &(r->d[nl]);
146
147 carry -= bn_sub_words(rp, ap, np, nl);
148 /*
149 * |carry| is -1 if |ap| - |np| underflowed or zero if it did not. Note
150 * |carry| cannot be 1. That would imply the subtraction did not fit in
151 * |nl| words, and we know at most one subtraction is needed.
152 */
153 for (i = 0; i < nl; i++) {
154 rp[i] = (carry & ap[i]) | (~carry & rp[i]);
155 ap[i] = 0;
156 }
157
158 return 1;
159}
160#endif /* MONT_WORD */
161
162int BN_from_montgomery(BIGNUM *ret, const BIGNUM *a, BN_MONT_CTX *mont,
163 BN_CTX *ctx)
164{
165 int retn;
166
167 retn = bn_from_mont_fixed_top(ret, a, mont, ctx);
168 bn_correct_top(ret);
169 bn_check_top(ret);
170
171 return retn;
172}
173
174int bn_from_mont_fixed_top(BIGNUM *ret, const BIGNUM *a, BN_MONT_CTX *mont,
175 BN_CTX *ctx)
176{
177 int retn = 0;
178#ifdef MONT_WORD
179 BIGNUM *t;
180
181 BN_CTX_start(ctx);
182 if ((t = BN_CTX_get(ctx)) && BN_copy(t, a)) {
183 retn = bn_from_montgomery_word(ret, t, mont);
184 }
185 BN_CTX_end(ctx);
186#else /* !MONT_WORD */
187 BIGNUM *t1, *t2;
188
189 BN_CTX_start(ctx);
190 t1 = BN_CTX_get(ctx);
191 t2 = BN_CTX_get(ctx);
192 if (t2 == NULL)
193 goto err;
194
195 if (!BN_copy(t1, a))
196 goto err;
197 BN_mask_bits(t1, mont->ri);
198
199 if (!BN_mul(t2, t1, &mont->Ni, ctx))
200 goto err;
201 BN_mask_bits(t2, mont->ri);
202
203 if (!BN_mul(t1, t2, &mont->N, ctx))
204 goto err;
205 if (!BN_add(t2, a, t1))
206 goto err;
207 if (!BN_rshift(ret, t2, mont->ri))
208 goto err;
209
210#if !defined(BRANCH_FREE) || BRANCH_FREE==0
211 if (BN_ucmp(ret, &(mont->N)) >= 0) {
212 if (!BN_usub(ret, ret, &(mont->N)))
213 goto err;
214 }
215#endif
216 retn = 1;
217 bn_check_top(ret);
218 err:
219 BN_CTX_end(ctx);
220#endif /* MONT_WORD */
221 return retn;
222}
223
224int bn_to_mont_fixed_top(BIGNUM *r, const BIGNUM *a, BN_MONT_CTX *mont,
225 BN_CTX *ctx)
226{
227 return bn_mul_mont_fixed_top(r, a, &(mont->RR), mont, ctx);
228}
229
230BN_MONT_CTX *BN_MONT_CTX_new(void)
231{
232 BN_MONT_CTX *ret;
233
234 if ((ret = OPENSSL_malloc(sizeof(*ret))) == NULL) {
235 BNerr(BN_F_BN_MONT_CTX_NEW, ERR_R_MALLOC_FAILURE);
236 return NULL;
237 }
238
239 BN_MONT_CTX_init(ret);
240 ret->flags = BN_FLG_MALLOCED;
241 return ret;
242}
243
244void BN_MONT_CTX_init(BN_MONT_CTX *ctx)
245{
246 ctx->ri = 0;
247 bn_init(&ctx->RR);
248 bn_init(&ctx->N);
249 bn_init(&ctx->Ni);
250 ctx->n0[0] = ctx->n0[1] = 0;
251 ctx->flags = 0;
252}
253
254void BN_MONT_CTX_free(BN_MONT_CTX *mont)
255{
256 if (mont == NULL)
257 return;
258 BN_clear_free(&mont->RR);
259 BN_clear_free(&mont->N);
260 BN_clear_free(&mont->Ni);
261 if (mont->flags & BN_FLG_MALLOCED)
262 OPENSSL_free(mont);
263}
264
265int BN_MONT_CTX_set(BN_MONT_CTX *mont, const BIGNUM *mod, BN_CTX *ctx)
266{
267 int i, ret = 0;
268 BIGNUM *Ri, *R;
269
270 if (BN_is_zero(mod))
271 return 0;
272
273 BN_CTX_start(ctx);
274 if ((Ri = BN_CTX_get(ctx)) == NULL)
275 goto err;
276 R = &(mont->RR); /* grab RR as a temp */
277 if (!BN_copy(&(mont->N), mod))
278 goto err; /* Set N */
279 if (BN_get_flags(mod, BN_FLG_CONSTTIME) != 0)
280 BN_set_flags(&(mont->N), BN_FLG_CONSTTIME);
281 mont->N.neg = 0;
282
283#ifdef MONT_WORD
284 {
285 BIGNUM tmod;
286 BN_ULONG buf[2];
287
288 bn_init(&tmod);
289 tmod.d = buf;
290 tmod.dmax = 2;
291 tmod.neg = 0;
292
293 if (BN_get_flags(mod, BN_FLG_CONSTTIME) != 0)
294 BN_set_flags(&tmod, BN_FLG_CONSTTIME);
295
296 mont->ri = (BN_num_bits(mod) + (BN_BITS2 - 1)) / BN_BITS2 * BN_BITS2;
297
298# if defined(OPENSSL_BN_ASM_MONT) && (BN_BITS2<=32)
299 /*
300 * Only certain BN_BITS2<=32 platforms actually make use of n0[1],
301 * and we could use the #else case (with a shorter R value) for the
302 * others. However, currently only the assembler files do know which
303 * is which.
304 */
305
306 BN_zero(R);
307 if (!(BN_set_bit(R, 2 * BN_BITS2)))
308 goto err;
309
310 tmod.top = 0;
311 if ((buf[0] = mod->d[0]))
312 tmod.top = 1;
313 if ((buf[1] = mod->top > 1 ? mod->d[1] : 0))
314 tmod.top = 2;
315
316 if (BN_is_one(&tmod))
317 BN_zero(Ri);
318 else if ((BN_mod_inverse(Ri, R, &tmod, ctx)) == NULL)
319 goto err;
320 if (!BN_lshift(Ri, Ri, 2 * BN_BITS2))
321 goto err; /* R*Ri */
322 if (!BN_is_zero(Ri)) {
323 if (!BN_sub_word(Ri, 1))
324 goto err;
325 } else { /* if N mod word size == 1 */
326
327 if (bn_expand(Ri, (int)sizeof(BN_ULONG) * 2) == NULL)
328 goto err;
329 /* Ri-- (mod double word size) */
330 Ri->neg = 0;
331 Ri->d[0] = BN_MASK2;
332 Ri->d[1] = BN_MASK2;
333 Ri->top = 2;
334 }
335 if (!BN_div(Ri, NULL, Ri, &tmod, ctx))
336 goto err;
337 /*
338 * Ni = (R*Ri-1)/N, keep only couple of least significant words:
339 */
340 mont->n0[0] = (Ri->top > 0) ? Ri->d[0] : 0;
341 mont->n0[1] = (Ri->top > 1) ? Ri->d[1] : 0;
342# else
343 BN_zero(R);
344 if (!(BN_set_bit(R, BN_BITS2)))
345 goto err; /* R */
346
347 buf[0] = mod->d[0]; /* tmod = N mod word size */
348 buf[1] = 0;
349 tmod.top = buf[0] != 0 ? 1 : 0;
350 /* Ri = R^-1 mod N */
351 if (BN_is_one(&tmod))
352 BN_zero(Ri);
353 else if ((BN_mod_inverse(Ri, R, &tmod, ctx)) == NULL)
354 goto err;
355 if (!BN_lshift(Ri, Ri, BN_BITS2))
356 goto err; /* R*Ri */
357 if (!BN_is_zero(Ri)) {
358 if (!BN_sub_word(Ri, 1))
359 goto err;
360 } else { /* if N mod word size == 1 */
361
362 if (!BN_set_word(Ri, BN_MASK2))
363 goto err; /* Ri-- (mod word size) */
364 }
365 if (!BN_div(Ri, NULL, Ri, &tmod, ctx))
366 goto err;
367 /*
368 * Ni = (R*Ri-1)/N, keep only least significant word:
369 */
370 mont->n0[0] = (Ri->top > 0) ? Ri->d[0] : 0;
371 mont->n0[1] = 0;
372# endif
373 }
374#else /* !MONT_WORD */
375 { /* bignum version */
376 mont->ri = BN_num_bits(&mont->N);
377 BN_zero(R);
378 if (!BN_set_bit(R, mont->ri))
379 goto err; /* R = 2^ri */
380 /* Ri = R^-1 mod N */
381 if ((BN_mod_inverse(Ri, R, &mont->N, ctx)) == NULL)
382 goto err;
383 if (!BN_lshift(Ri, Ri, mont->ri))
384 goto err; /* R*Ri */
385 if (!BN_sub_word(Ri, 1))
386 goto err;
387 /*
388 * Ni = (R*Ri-1) / N
389 */
390 if (!BN_div(&(mont->Ni), NULL, Ri, &mont->N, ctx))
391 goto err;
392 }
393#endif
394
395 /* setup RR for conversions */
396 BN_zero(&(mont->RR));
397 if (!BN_set_bit(&(mont->RR), mont->ri * 2))
398 goto err;
399 if (!BN_mod(&(mont->RR), &(mont->RR), &(mont->N), ctx))
400 goto err;
401
402 for (i = mont->RR.top, ret = mont->N.top; i < ret; i++)
403 mont->RR.d[i] = 0;
404 mont->RR.top = ret;
405 mont->RR.flags |= BN_FLG_FIXED_TOP;
406
407 ret = 1;
408 err:
409 BN_CTX_end(ctx);
410 return ret;
411}
412
413BN_MONT_CTX *BN_MONT_CTX_copy(BN_MONT_CTX *to, BN_MONT_CTX *from)
414{
415 if (to == from)
416 return to;
417
418 if (!BN_copy(&(to->RR), &(from->RR)))
419 return NULL;
420 if (!BN_copy(&(to->N), &(from->N)))
421 return NULL;
422 if (!BN_copy(&(to->Ni), &(from->Ni)))
423 return NULL;
424 to->ri = from->ri;
425 to->n0[0] = from->n0[0];
426 to->n0[1] = from->n0[1];
427 return to;
428}
429
430BN_MONT_CTX *BN_MONT_CTX_set_locked(BN_MONT_CTX **pmont, CRYPTO_RWLOCK *lock,
431 const BIGNUM *mod, BN_CTX *ctx)
432{
433 BN_MONT_CTX *ret;
434
435 CRYPTO_THREAD_read_lock(lock);
436 ret = *pmont;
437 CRYPTO_THREAD_unlock(lock);
438 if (ret)
439 return ret;
440
441 /*
442 * We don't want to serialise globally while doing our lazy-init math in
443 * BN_MONT_CTX_set. That punishes threads that are doing independent
444 * things. Instead, punish the case where more than one thread tries to
445 * lazy-init the same 'pmont', by having each do the lazy-init math work
446 * independently and only use the one from the thread that wins the race
447 * (the losers throw away the work they've done).
448 */
449 ret = BN_MONT_CTX_new();
450 if (ret == NULL)
451 return NULL;
452 if (!BN_MONT_CTX_set(ret, mod, ctx)) {
453 BN_MONT_CTX_free(ret);
454 return NULL;
455 }
456
457 /* The locked compare-and-set, after the local work is done. */
458 CRYPTO_THREAD_write_lock(lock);
459 if (*pmont) {
460 BN_MONT_CTX_free(ret);
461 ret = *pmont;
462 } else
463 *pmont = ret;
464 CRYPTO_THREAD_unlock(lock);
465 return ret;
466}
